author: Anthony Teles
title: The One, Openings, and Revised Projects Topped Headlines in December, 2023
text:
Toronto finished off 2023 with a warm December and a rainy holiday season, giving us time off without frostbite or snowstorms. Prior to the holidays, it was a month where a number of revamped development proposals ranked amongst the top news stories, alongside our usual suspects of most followed projects. Like recent months,
The One, Pinnacle One Yonge, and The Well continue to vie for the top of each list. Let's take a closer look at our top stories, database files, and threads for December, 2023.
Our Top 10 Most Read News Stories:
In the honourable mention spot â€” and part of the reason for The Well being at or near the top of the next two lists â€” is part two of UrbanToronto's tour of the site. After a look at The Well's
public spaces and community engagement, we turned our focus to its shops and offices. This included an exclusive tour of BDP Quadrangle's new office at the site. That two-storey office's open spaces and modern approach to collaboration echoed throughout the spaces of The Well, which we got to experience for the first time.
15.
UrbanToronto Tours The Well: Shops and Offices Begin to Open
Making our way through the top 10, The One reclaims the #1 spot as construction crosses the 150m threshold to bring the project into skyscraper territory. Resubmitted proposals seeking greater density and height, meanwhile, where another highlight of the month, capturing spots #2, #4, #5, and #7, with the former three all looking to boost the heights of their towers. At #7,
589 Eglinton Avenue East's revised proposal adds density, but reworks the design to keep the storey-count the same.
10.
43-Storey Mixed-Use Development Proposed Next to Bayview Station
9.
Another 50-Storey Tower Proposed Close to Future Steeles Station
8.
Brampton Studies New Downtown Transit Hub
7.
Revamped Proposal at Leaside Station Adds Units, Reworks Design
6.
50-Storey Tower Proposed by Future Steeles Station
5.
Proposal Jumps to Dual 59-Storey Towers at Eglinton and Mount Pleasant
4.
Thornhill High-Rise Proposal Grows Taller Near Future Clark Station
3.
Toronto Opens Affordable Housing at Birchmount Green in Scarborough
2.
Yonge & Gerrard Proposal Increased to 85 Storeys
1.
The One Reaches Skyscraper Status as Construction Continues
Our Top 10 Most Searched Database Files:
Having wrapped up major construction in late 2023, IMMIX kicks off our top 10 database files at #13. The project has garnered plenty of attention for how it has
retained and restored the historic clock tower at the site while also recreating the 1872-built Fire Hall Number 3 it was attached to in a "ghost image." From the late 1960s to the 1980s, the St Charles Tavern on the site was an important gathering spot for the LGBTQ2S+ community, a fact reflected in the Progress Pride Flag colours painted on the clock tower's spire.
13.
IMMIX
The top 10 list boasted many of our usual top performers throughout 2023, with Concord Canada House and TD Terrace returning to the list at #8 and #10 respectively after sitting outside the top 10 in November. At #3, 101 Spadina continued to remain popular after a marketing-related updates, jumping ahead oft Pinnacle One Yonge at #4. The One and The Well, unsurprisingly, top the list, with the only question being who would be #1 â€” this month, it was The Well, denying The One a trifecta. The Well has opened its doors to the public â€” with more openings planned for opening in 2024, including the 70,000 ftÂ² Wellington Market.
10.
TD Terrace
9.
Concord Sky
7.
Sugar Wharf Condominiums (Phase 2)
6.
Forma
5.
CIBC SQUARE
3.
101 Spadina
2.
The One
1.
The Well
Our Top 10 Busiest Threads:
As we venture to the most popular threads of the month, we once again find several transit projects on the list. Starting the top 10 at #14 is the 10.3km-
Finch West LRT, the 18 stops of which will make the city's northwest far more accessible when it opens sometime in 2024. Meanwhile, the Crosstown LRT at #8 is inching its way to another sometime-in-2024 finish line, while the hectic Yonge and Eglinton intersection is now mostly reopened.
14.
Finch West LRT
The One continues to reign supreme as our busiest thread, closely followed again by Pinnacle One Yonge and The Well. In addition to the LRTs, another transit project includes the neverending
Union Station Revitalization at #7.
10.
Lower Don Lands Redevelopment
8.
Eglinton Line 5 Crosstown LRT
7.
Union Station Revitalization
6.
https://urbantoronto.ca/forum/threads/toronto-forma-308m-84s-great-gulf-gehry-partners.19170/
5.
KING Toronto
4.
https://urbantoronto.ca/forum/threads/toronto-cibc-square-241-39m-50s-hines-wilkinsoneyre.674/
3.
https://urbantoronto.ca/forum/threads/toronto-the-well-174-03m-46s-riocan-hariri-pontarini.19291/
1.
https://urbantoronto.ca/forum/threads/toronto-the-one-338-3m-94s-mizrahi-developments-foster-partners.18167/
We will be back at the beginning of February for a recap of January's top news stories, Database files, and Forum threads!
* * *
UrbanToronto has a research service,
UrbanToronto Pro, that provides comprehensive data on construction projects in the Greater Toronto Areaâ€”from proposal through to completion. We also offer Instant Reports, downloadable snapshots based on location, and a daily subscription newsletter, New Development Insider, that tracks projects from initial application.

author: MarÃ­a Albert
title: La Aemet avisa del tiempo que va a hacer en EspaÃ±a durante el puente de Todos los Santos: esta es la fecha ...
text: Las Ãºltimas horas en EspaÃ±a han dejado un panorama desolador. Desde este pasado martes, una DANA (depresiÃ³n aislada en niveles altos) ha dejado mÃºltiples destrozos materiales en la PenÃ­nsula y se ha cobrado casi 150 vidas durante las inundaciones que ha ocasionado. Localidades de Comunidad Valenciana, AndalucÃ­a, CataluÃ±a y Castilla-La Mancha han vivido la peor cara de este temporal, que continÃºa afectando ahora a nuestro paÃ­s, segÃºn ha advertido la Agencia Estatal de MeteorologÃ­a ( Aemet ).Tras esta situaciÃ³n de emergencia , la mirada estÃ¡ puesta ahora en la evoluciÃ³n de esta DANA y en cuÃ¡nto durarÃ¡n las desvastadoras consecuencias que ha ocasionado durante su paso por nuestro paÃ­s. Ahora, coincidiendo con el Puente de Todos los Santos , que comienza este 1 de noviembre, el temporal se dirige hacia Portugal, aunque las lluvias no desaparecerÃ¡n de nuestro paÃ­s y todavÃ­a existe peligro. SegÃºn la Aemet, durante las prÃ³ximas horas seguiremos inmersos en un episodio de fuertes lluvias , que dejarÃ¡ precipitaciones en muchos puntos del este del paÃ­s. Pero Â¿hasta cuÃ¡ndo va a durar definitivamente esta DANA segÃºn la Aemet? Esto es lo que sucederÃ¡ con el tiempo durante el puente de noviembre.Noticias Relacionadas estandar No Directo Los muertos por la DANA ascienden a 155 sÃ³lo en Valencia M. Lozano, A. CaparrÃ³s y D. Maroto estandar No DANA y temporal Estas son las carreteras por las que la DGT pide que no circules durante el puente Canal Motor Â¿Hasta cuÃ¡ndo va a durar la DANA en EspaÃ±a?SegÃºn recoge eltiempo.es , este viernes 1 de noviembre, coincidiendo con el festivo de Todos los Santos en EspaÃ±a , la DANA se situarÃ¡ al oeste de la penÃ­nsula, sobre Portugal. Durante toda esta jornada, se mantendrÃ¡n los vientos de levante, que irÃ¡n Â«aportando humedad en el MediterrÃ¡neoÂ» , manteniendo las precipitaciones en las mismas zonas afectadas por el temporal en las Ãºltimas horas.Tendremos lluvias fuertes a lo largo de la festividad en el nordeste y suroeste peninsular, que incluso podrÃ­an alcanzar las islas Baleares a lo largo del dÃ­a, descargando allÃ­ chubascos bastante intensos. Tal y como ha confirmado la Aemet, en muchas zonas de EspaÃ±a Â«continuarÃ¡ la situaciÃ³n adversa durante el fin de semanaÂ»: Â« La emergencia meteorolÃ³gica no ha finalizado . La DANA sigue sobre EspaÃ±aÂ», han advertido desde el servicio meteorolÃ³gico, que mantendrÃ¡ este viernes los avisos de nivel naranja en estas regiones por acumulaciones que podrÃ­an superar los 50 mm en 1 hora .La DANA irÃ¡ perdiendo intensidad durante las primeras horas del fin de semana y se irÃ¡ debilitando conforme esta avance hacia el sur. A pesar de ello, las lluvias seguirÃ¡n manteniÃ©ndose en muchos puntos del paÃ­s y desde la Aemet piden precauciÃ³n ante sus posibles consecuencias. Â«El jueves y viernes habrÃ¡ tormentas de nuevo en el sur de CataluÃ±a , localmente intensas y otra vez lluvias abundantes en Extremadura y AndalucÃ­a Occidental Â», ha explicado RubÃ©n del Campo. A pesar de ello, desde el organismo seÃ±alan que estas precipitaciones no tendrÃ¡n Â«nada que ver con lo que hemos visto en el Ã¡rea mediterrÃ¡neaÂ». Se esperan registros que, en algunos casos, podrÃ­an superar los 15 o 20 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora: Â« Son lluvias abundantes, pero no torrenciales Â», han advertido desde la Aemet, que espera lluvias localmente intensas durante el fin de semana en puntos del MediterrÃ¡neo y del sur de AndalucÃ­a.Las temperaturas para el Puente de Todos los SantosDurante este puente de noviembre, todavÃ­a quedarÃ¡n algunos Â« restos de inestabilidad en zonas del MediterrÃ¡neo entre Baleares, CataluÃ±a y el norte de la Comunidad ValencianaÂ», segÃºn ha explicado el meteorÃ³logo Mario Picazo. Â« No tengas sensaciÃ³n de falsa seguridad en zonas del litoral donde no llueveÂ», han advertido desde la Aemet, explicando que la orografÃ­a puede amplificar las precipitaciones de estas prÃ³ximas horas.Aunque el organismo ha pedido mantener la Â«precauciÃ³nÂ» y estar atento a los cambios en la previsiÃ³n meteorolÃ³gica, todo apunta a que la estabilidad irÃ¡ ganando terreno a las lluvias conforme avance el fin de semana del Puente de Todos los Santos. A lo largo del fin de semana, tendremos tambiÃ©n temperaturas en general suaves para la Ã©poca. Durante estos dÃ­as, los valores rondarÃ¡n los 20 grados en muchas capitales, mientras que en Baleares y Canarias podrÃ­an acercarse a los 25 grados de mÃ¡xima . Por su parte, en la meseta norte y el oeste peninsular podrÃ­an registrarse algunos termÃ³metros algo mÃ¡s frescos, aunque todo apunta a que las mÃ­nimas se mantendrÃ¡n por encima de los 10 grados .

author: MENAFN
title: Global Agricultural Biotechnology Market Size To Worth USD 268.32 Billion By 2033 | CAGR Of 8.27%
text:
( MENAFN - GlobeNewsWire - Nasdaq) The Global Agricultural Biotechnology market Size was Valued at USD 121.24 Billion in 2023 and the Worldwide Agricultural Biotechnology Market Size is Expected to Reach USD 268.32 Billion by 2033, according to a research report published by Spherical Insights & Consulting. Companies covered: ADAMA Ltd, Bayer AG, ChemChina, Corteva, Evogene Ltd., KWS SAAT SE & Co., KGaA, Limagrain, Marrone Bio Innovations, MITSUI & CO., Nufarm, Performance plants Inc., Valent BioSciences LLC, and Other key vendors.
New York, United States, July 18, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The Global Agricultural Biotechnology Market Size is to Grow from USD 121.24 Billion in 2023 to USD 268.32 Billion by 2033, at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 8.27% during the projected period.
Get a Sample PDF Brochure:
Agricultural biotechnology is a specialized branch of biotechnology that uses scientific methods to apply scientific principles to enhance agricultural practices. improving crop yields, pest resistance, and lowering reliance on chemical fertilizers and pesticides are all obtained through the administration of living things, including plants, animals, and microbes. Focusing on addressing some of the most urgent problems, including food security and sustainable agriculture, agricultural biotechnology uses technologies like genetic engineering, tissue culture, and molecular diagnostics to generate more prosperous, nutrient-dense, and abundant crops. Farmer productivity increases with reduced inputs due to modern biotechnology. The global need for more agricultural yields and sustainable farming methods is the main factor conditioning the global market. Furthermore, by using scientific methods to modify and improve the characteristics of plants, animals, and microbes, biotechnology acts as a catalyst to boost the value of these living things. An important subset of biotechnology called agricultural biotechnology is concerned with improving agricultural methods and results. Genetic engineering technologies represent a revolutionary frontier in agricultural innovation, even if traditional techniques like selection and breeding have long been used to develop agriculturally significant species. Furthermore, However, agricultural biotechnology is being implemented. determining its potential effects on the environment and public health is therefore difficult.
Browse key industry insights spread across 213 pages with 110 Market data tables and figures & charts from the " Global Agricultural Biotechnology Market Size, Share, and COVID-19 Impact Analysis, By Organism Type (Plants, Animals, and Microbes), By Technology (Genetic Engineering, Molecular Breeding, Molecular Diagnostics, and Tissue Culture), By Application (Vaccine Development, Transgenic Crops & Animals, Antibiotic Development, Nutritional Supplements, and Biofuels), and By Region (North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, Latin America, Middle East, and Africa), Analysis and Forecast 2023 â€“ 2033."
Buy Now Full Report:
The plants segment is anticipated to hold the greatest share of the global agricultural biotechnology market during the projected timeframe.
Based on the organism type, the global agricultural biotechnology market is divided into plants, animals, and microbes . Among these, the plants segment is anticipated to hold the greatest share of the global agricultural biotechnology market during the projected timeframe. Agricultural biotechnology is crucial for protecting crops from harmful diseases, increasing crop resilience, and increasing farmer income. A variety of advantages are provided by biotech crops, including enhanced crop quality and possibly higher outputs. Adoption of these crops can also improve adaptability and safety for farmers by streamlining farming procedures.
The genetic engineering segment is expected to grow at the fastest CAGR in the global agricultural biotechnology market during the projected timeframe.
Based on the technology, the global agricultural biotechnology market is divided into genetic engineering, molecular breeding, molecular diagnostics, and tissue culture. Among these, the genetic engineering segment is expected to grow at the fastest CAGR in the global agricultural biotechnology market during the projected timeframe. An essential role in changing agricultural sustainability, insect resistance, and crop improvement. This dominance, which is propelling agricultural innovation and global food security measures, showcases the tremendous progress obtained in evolving genetic administration techniques to enhance crop features, raise yields, and lower environmental constraints.
The transgenic crops & animals segment is predicted at the largest revenue share in the global agricultural biotechnology market during the estimated period.
Based on the application, the global agricultural biotechnology market is divided into vaccine development, transgenic crops & animals, antibiotic development, nutritional supplements, and biofuels. Among these, the transgenic crops & animals segment is predicted at the largest revenue share in the global agricultural biotechnology market during the estimated period. Transgenesis is a vital technology in this field that encompasses the enrichment of animal products with nutrients, enhancing their quality and quantity while tailoring their nutritional profiles. With the use of this technique, it is possible to transfer or enhance nutritionally advantageous features, improving the overall nutritional profile of meals obtained from animals.
Inquire Before Buying This Research Report:
North America is expected to hold the largest share of the global agricultural biotechnology market over the forecast period .
North America is expected to hold the largest share of the global agricultural biotechnology market over the forecast period. The agricultural biotechnology market in North America is rising rapidly as a result of some connected factors. Research and development are supported by a strong institutional network and a significant private sector investment. Demand in the industry is also boosted by consumer preferences for premium, comprehensively produced food items.
Asia Pacific is predicted to grow at the fastest pace in the global agricultural biotechnology market during the projected timeframe. Farmers in this region are becoming more and more interested in using advanced farming methods. Additionally, rising population need for food and rising consumer disposable incomes will boost future industry expansion.
Competitive Analysis:
The report offers the appropriate analysis of the key organizations/companies involved within the global market along with a comparative evaluation primarily based on their product offering, business overviews, geographic presence, enterprise strategies, segment market share, and SWOT analysis. The report also provides an elaborative analysis focusing on the current news and developments of the companies, which includes product development, innovations, joint ventures, partnerships, mergers & acquisitions, strategic alliances, and others. This allows for the evaluation of the overall competition within the market. KGaA, Limagrain, Marrone Bio Innovations, MITSUI & CO., LTD, Nufarm, Performance Plants Inc., Valent BioSciences LLC, and Others.

author: financialcontent.com
title: Synergy Credit Union Partners with Kuusoft to Enhance Customer Experience | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Synergy Credit Union Partners with Kuusoft to Elevate Member Experience with NexSigns Digital Signage Solutions.
Kuusoft , a leading provider of digital signage solutions, proudly announces a strategic partnership with Synergy Credit Union , a prominent retail credit union based in Saskatchewan, Canada. The collaboration aims to elevate the member experience through the deployment of Kuusoft's innovative digital signage product, NexSigns.
Synergy Credit Union is a customer-centric retail bank dedicated to serving the financial needs of its members. With a commitment to fostering strong community relationships, Synergy Credit Union delivers a wide range of financial products and services, emphasizing personalized solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of its diverse membership.
As a retail credit union, Synergy Credit Union operates in the financial services industry, serving the residents of Saskatchewan. The credit union has a strong presence in the region, with a network of branches strategically located to offer accessible financial services to its members.
The decision to partner with Kuusoft and implement NexSigns was led by Camanie Glynn, Marketing Technology Specialist. The digital signage solution will be utilized across all ten branches, including several video walls and a large LED panel at the main branch in Lloydminster, Saskatchewan.
The primary objective is to enhance customer engagement by showcasing rate information and marketing materials through dynamic digital displays. The deployment of NexSigns replaces Synergy Credit Union's previous digital signage provider, offering a more user-friendly solution.
Synergy Credit Union faced challenges with their previous digital signage vendor: slow response times and a lack of proactive support. Camanie Glynn highlighted the frustration of dealing with ongoing issues and the need for a simpler setup that allows the credit union to focus on serving its members.
"We envision having a consistent point of contact who truly understands our systems and has the tools to let us focus on what we do best, without constantly dealing with digital display issues," said Camanie Glynn.
Synergy Credit Union chose Kuusoft for its commitment to providing a comprehensive solution aligned with the credit union's vision. The NexSigns digital signage platform with video wall hardware, offers a user-friendly experience, allowing for efficient content management and reducing the need for hands-on troubleshooting.
With all ten locations now using NexSigns, Synergy Credit Union looks forward to a positive and collaborative partnership with Kuusoft. The implementation aligns with the credit union's goal of delivering a seamless customer experience while streamlining its digital signage operations.
About Kuusoft:
Kuusoft is a leading provider of digital signage solutions, offering innovative products and services designed to transform communication in various industries. With a focus on delivering dynamic and engaging content, Kuusoft empowers businesses to connect with their audiences effectively.
To learn more, please visit www.kuusoft.com or call 604-639-7055.
About Synergy Credit Union:
It has been serving communities since 1943. Dedicated to making life and community prosperous. For Synergy, itâ€™s about connection and doing the right thing. Synergy builds relationships beyond banking.
 Kuusoft Corp.
Contact Person: Kuusoft Marketing
Email: Send Email
Phone: 604-639-7055
Address: 235-5589 Byrne Rd.
City: Burnaby
State: British Columbia
Country: Canada
Website: https://www.kuusoft.com/

author: Ashli Lincoln
title: Atlanta man can only be taken off life support with this legal document, family says â€“ WSB-TV Channel 2 - Atlanta
text: ATLANTA â€” The family of an Atlanta man on life support says it will be up to a judge to decide if he can be taken off. They want to warn others about an important document they say families should get to prevent the courts from stepping in. [DOWNLOAD: [Free WSB-TV News app for alerts as news breaks](https://www.wsbtv.com/smart-tv/)] Attorney Jennifer Hyman says an advance directive for healthcare can save familiesâ€™ heartache and court battles. â€œItâ€™s similar, in a way, to getting a will done. Itâ€™s a legal document that tells your healthcare providers how you want your medical treatment in the event you need life-sustaining treatment,â€ said Hyman. Rajesh Shinde says he wishes his family had one of those documents when discussing removing his brother from life support. â€œHeâ€™s going to be in the vegetative state for the rest of his life,â€ said Shinde. Shinde says itâ€™s been an agonizing five years watching his younger brother on life support. TRENDING STORIES: [19-year-old arrested for shooting, killing woman inside Atlanta McDonaldâ€™s, police say](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/atlanta/19-year-old-arrested-shooting-killing-woman-inside-atlanta-mcdonalds-police-say/64CFUV2EXVFNJB5Q5OF2QF4JTU/) [Utah couple killed in car crash on way to announce pregnancy to family at Christmas](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/trending/utah-couple-killed-car-crash-way-announce-pregnancy-family-christmas/P6VYNNVVJFHPRGP5LKNSHWGODY/) [Police nab alleged 40-year-old Ga. drug dealer trafficking nearly 7,000 fatal doses of fentanyl](https://www.wsbtv.com/news/local/clarke-county/police-nab-alleged-40-year-old-ga-drug-dealer-trafficking-nearly-7000-fatal-doses-fentanyl/ULXUSGS35RBMFBJJLILYMVQ3BI/) Shinde told Channel 2 investigative reporter Ashli Lincoln his brother suffered a brain aneurysm in 2018. Now a state judge will have to decide if he can be taken off of life support after his brotherâ€™s ex-wife petitioned for him to remain on life support. â€œThis is a tough situation that a lot of families have to go through,â€ Shinde told Lincoln. â€œWhat you heard is kind of a classic case (of) why people need to get these advanced healthcare directives,â€ Hyman explained. Hyman says getting an advance medical directive is relatively simple by contacting an attorney and completing the necessary paperwork. The state of Georgia expanded advanced directive laws in 2007 and similar expansions are happening nationwide. This year the Uniform Law Commission expanded the Health Care Decisions Act to make it easier for people to create and use advance directives. For information on Georgiaâ€™s Medical Directive, [click](https://www.scribd.com/document/695375523/Georgia-Advance-Directive-for-Health-Care-2016) [ here](https://www.scribd.com/document/695375523/Georgia-Advance-Directive-for-Health-Care-2016). author: Shahrizal
title: Kosovo Deputy Minister Visits Malaysia To Strengthen Trade And Halal Ties
text:
Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Diaspora of Kosovo, Kreshnik Ahmeti, is on a two-day working visit to Malaysia from July 24 to 25, 2025, following the official visit by Kosovo President Dr Vjosa Osmani Sadriu in May.
Ahmeti is scheduled to meet Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Datuk Mohamad Alamin for discussions on trade, investment, Islamic finance, the halal industry and tourism, alongside regional and international issues of mutual concern.
His itinerary also includes meetings with the Deputy Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry and the Chairman of the Parliamentary Special Select Committee on International Relations and International Trade. Ahmeti is also expected to engage with the Halal Development Corporation to explore collaboration opportunities in the halal sector.
Bilateral trade between Malaysia and Kosovo stood at RM28.55 million (US$6.26 million) in 2024, with Malaysia exporting RM25.92 million worth of goods, mainly palm oil, electrical and electronic products and manufactured goods, while imports from Kosovo were valued at RM2.63 million, primarily raw materials and semi-precious stones.
